title: Got ED summon or notice? Check how to find if it's fake or genuine in two simple steps
content:
HomeIndia NewsGot ED summon or notice? Check how to find if it's fake or genuine in two simple stepsEach genuine summon issued under this system now carries a QR code and a unique passcode, along with the signature, official seal, email address, and contact number of the issuing officer. ED officials have been directed to issue summons only through this verified system, except under special circumstances.The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has cautioned the public to remain alert against fake summons and notices being circulated by fraudsters posing as officials of the agency. It said that citizens should not fear the name of the ED but should stay vigilant and verify any summons or notices they receive through official channels — either by visiting the agency's website or contacting the official landline numbers.

The ED said certain individuals have been sending counterfeit summons that closely resemble genuine ones, making it difficult for recipients to distinguish between authentic and fake documents. The agency clarified that legitimate summons are issued only under Section 50(2) of the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), 2002, or Section 37 of the Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA), 1999.



To tackle the misuse, the ED headquarters has begun investigating the circulation of these fake summons using advanced digital tools. The agency has also rolled out a new verification system to help the public confirm the authenticity of any summons received.

Each genuine summon issued under this system now carries a QR code and a unique passcode, along with the signature, official seal, email address, and contact number of the issuing officer. ED officials have been directed to issue summons only through this verified system, except under special circumstances.

Recipients can verify the authenticity of a summons in two steps:
 	Scan the QR code printed on the summons, which will redirect to the ED's official website.
 	Enter the unique passcode provided on the document in the verification field.

If the details are valid, the system will display key information — such as the name of the person summoned, the issuing officer's name and designation, and the date of issue — confirming that the summons is genuine.

The ED has urged citizens to always verify any suspicious summons through the official QR code and passcode system to protect themselves from fraud and impersonation.(Edited by : Priyanka Rathi)

title: Tinder in India now checks video selfies to block fake profiles
content:
HomeTechnology NewsTinder in India now checks video selfies to block fake profilesTinder has rolled out Face Check in India, a new feature that uses video selfies to verify users, reduce fake profiles to enhance safety for those seeking connections on the app.Online dating app Tinder, on Wednesday, introduced a new feature in India called Face Check to help users avoid fake profiles and make the app safer. The tool requires new users to record a short video selfie. This selfie is then compared to the photos they have on their profile.

If the pictures match, the user receives a Photo Verified badge, which signals to others that the person is real and not a bot or someone using fake photos.

Tinder says Face Check is part of its ongoing efforts to limit scams, bots, and impersonation on the platform. The company has previously introduced several safety tools for Indian users, such as:
 	ID Verification – Users can verify their identity by submitting official identification documents.
 	Warnings – Alerts that notify users if someone is sending suspicious or harmful messages.
 	Are You Sure – A feature that asks users to reconsider before sending messages that might be offensive.
 	Does This Bother You – Allows users to report behaviour they find uncomfortable or inappropriate.
 	Reporting enhancements – Improvements to how users can report suspicious or unsafe accounts.

According to Tinder’s Modern Dating Report, many young Indian users value authenticity and safety. More than one in three consider profile verification an important factor when choosing potential matches.

Users also take other precautions, such as meeting in public places (50%), sharing plans with friends or family (42%), avoiding sharing personal information (40%), and video calling before meeting someone in person (37%).

title: CJI Gavai attack: Supreme Court lawyer seeks contempt proceedings against Rakesh Kishore
content:
HomeIndia NewsCJI Gavai attack: Supreme Court lawyer seeks contempt proceedings against Rakesh KishoreAdv Subhash Chandran KR wrote a letter to Attorney General R Venkataramani seeking consent under Section 15 of the Contempt of Courts Act, 1971. He said that Kishore's actions undermined the Supreme Court's dignity.(Photo Credit : CJI BR Gavai (left), and Advocate Rakesh Kishore. (Photo: PTI and Social Media via News18) )A contempt proceeding has been sought by a Supreme Court lawyer against Advocate Rakesh Kishore who attempted to attack Chief Justice BR Gavai by throwing a shoe at him when he was hearing cases in the court.

Adv Subhash Chandran KR wrote a letter to Attorney General R Venkataramani seeking consent under Section 15 of the Contempt of Courts Act, 1971, reported LiveLaw.

He stated that Kishore's actions undermined the Supreme Court's dignity and amounted to interference with the administration of the justice.

"The most contemptuous act of the Contemnor diminishes the majesty and authority of the Hon'ble Supreme Court and defeats the Constitution of India," the letter said.

Chandran also stated that Kishore did not show remorse to his actions and made contemptuous remarks in the media. He said that Kishore tried to justify his actions and such a behaviour diminishes the confidence of the people in the judicial system.

He also called the actions as a deliberate attempt to scandalise the court.

The attack attempt on CJI Gavai

On Oct 7, Kishore had tried to remove his shoe and hurl at the Chief Justice of India after reaching the dais.

However, his attempts were immediately stopped by the security personnel in the court room who escorted him out.
He shouted, "Sanatan Dharm ka apmaan nahi sahenge (Will not tolerate insult to the Sanatan Dharma)," while moving out of the court.

He alleged that CJI Gavai had insulted the Sanatan Dharma and hurt the religious sentiments of the Hindu community through his remarks which could not be tolerated.

Later, the Kishore was suspended immediately by the Bar Council of India.

Kishore also said that he was not afraid and did not regret his actions.

"I was hurt... I was not inebriated, this was my reaction to his action... I am not fearful. I don't regret what happened," he told news agency ANI in an interview.
#WATCH | Delhi: Suspended Advocate Rakesh Kishore, who attempted to hurl an object at CJI BR Gavai, says, "...I was hurt...I was not inebriated, this was my reaction to his action...I am not fearful. I don't regret what happened."
"A PIL was filed in the Court of CJI on 16th… pic.twitter.com/6h4S47NxMd

— ANI (@ANI) October 7, 2025


CJI's remarks going viral on social media 

The incident was linked with CJI Gavai's earlier remarks in a case related to the restoration of the Lord Vishnu idol at the Khajuraho group of temples.

"Go and ask the deity itself to do something now. You say you are a staunch devotee of Lord Vishnu. So go and pray now. It’s an archaeological site and ASI needs to give permission etc," CJI Gavai had reportedly remarked while dismissing the plea, as per Bar and Bench.

His remarks were widely shared on social media and led to a controversy, with people alleging that the statement hurt religious sentiments.

Later, the CJI had clarified that he respects all religions and did not mean to hurt the sentiments of any community. "I respect all religions," CJI Gavai had said.

title: TVS to launch Apache RTX 300 on October 15, its first adventure-tourer bike
content:
HomeAuto NewsTVS to launch Apache RTX 300 on October 15, its first adventure-tourer bikeTVS Motor Company is launching the Apache RTX 300 on October 15. Its first adventure-tourer motorcycle features a 299cc RT-XD4 engine, trellis frame, 19/17-inch wheels, and new tech.TVS Motor Company is set to launch its first adventure motorcycle, the Apache RTX 300, in India on October 15. The bike was first unveiled at the Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025.

The Apache RTX 300 will be the first TVS model to feature the new 299cc RT-XD4 engine. This single-cylinder, liquid-cooled engine produces 34.5 hp at 9,000 rpm and 28.5 Nm of torque at 7,000 rpm. It is likely to be paired with a six-speed gearbox and a slipper clutch.
According to media reports, patent filings and test mule sightings have revealed the bike’s design. The Apache RTX 300 will have a semi-faired look with twin LED headlamps, LED turn indicators, a muscular fuel tank, LED tail lamps, and a transparent windshield. The rear will feature a split-pillion grab rail connected to a luggage rack and an upswept exhaust.

The bike is built on a trellis frame and will have a fully adjustable upside-down front fork and a monoshock at the rear. It is expected to come with 19-inch front and 17-inch rear alloy wheels, emphasising long-distance touring rather than off-road riding. Braking duties are likely to be handled by disc brakes.

The Apache RTX 300 is expected to come equipped with raised handlebars, a two-piece stepped seat, a luggage rack, and an upright windshield. It is also expected to offer modern features like a TFT display, multiple ride modes, and traction control.

The bike is likely to go up against the KTM 250 Adventure in India.(Edited by : Vivek Dubey)

title: Karur stampede: SC agrees to hear Vijay's TVK plea challenging Madras HC order to set up SIT
content:
HomeIndia NewsKarur stampede: SC agrees to hear Vijay's TVK plea challenging Madras HC order to set up SITThe stampede, which led to 41 deaths, injured more than 60 people. Police noted that the rally saw a turnout of 27,000, nearly three times the expected 10,000 participants. Police also blamed a seven-hour delay by Vijay in reaching the venue.The Supreme Court has agreed to hear the plea of Tamil actor Vijay’s political party Tamilaga Vettri Kazhagam (TVK) on October 10 with another plea related to the Karur stampede.

TVK moved the Supreme Court challenging the Madras High Court order constituting a Special Investigation Team (SIT) to probe the Karur stampede that killed 41 people.

A bench comprising Chief Justice BR Gavai and Justice K Vinod Chandran took note of the submissions of a lawyer that the plea, filed through TVK’s secretary Aadhav Arjuna, be listed for hearing.

Also read | Vijay reaches out to victims' families

On Tuesday, the Bench agreed to hear on October 10 BJP leader Uma Anandan's plea challenging the high court order refusing a CBI probe into the September 27 stampede and seeking a CBI investigation.

The CJI agreed to hear the instant plea on Friday with the other petition.

TVK has sought an independent investigation under the supervision of the Supreme Court, contending that a fair and impartial probe would not be possible if conducted solely by officers of the Tamil Nadu police.

The stampede, which led to 41 deaths, injured more than 60 people. Police noted that the rally saw a turnout of 27,000, nearly three times the expected 10,000 participants. Police also blamed a seven-hour delay by Vijay in reaching the venue.

State MinisterSenthil Balaji handed over cheques to those injured in the stampede today.First Published: Oct 8, 2025 12:15 PM IST

title: Jaipur-Ajmer highway blast: Tanker driver burnt alive after multiple cylinders explode due to collision
content:
HomeIndia NewsJaipur-Ajmer highway blast: Tanker driver burnt alive after multiple cylinders explode due to collisionThe truck carrying the CNG cylinders was reportedly parked outside a hotel as the driver had gone to have food. The tanker hit the truck leading to a collision which led to the tanker's cabin catching fire.(Photo Credit : Collision between a truck and tanker led to multiple cylinders explosion on Jaipur-Ajmer highway. (PTI Photo) )A tanker collided with a truck carrying gas cylinders on the Jaipur-Ajmer highway in Rajasthan late Tuesday night, October 7, triggering multiple explosions. The accident killed the tanker driver and left another person injured.

According to police officials cited by news agency PTI, the tanker — which was carrying chemicals — caught fire, and the driver was burnt alive in the incident.

"The tanker driver was burnt alive in the incident. Another man is injured," said Deepak Khandelwal, Deputy Superintendent of Police (DSP), of the Dudu town.

The traffic remained halted for several hours on the busy highway due to the accident.

The flames due to the explosions were visible from several kilometres away with loud sounds of the blasts being heard by the commuters.
#WATCH | A massive fire broke out near the Sawarda culvert in the Mauzamabad area on the Jaipur-Ajmer highway, after a vehicle allegedly hit a truck loaded with gas cylinders. pic.twitter.com/eHLiCfujbu
— ANI (@ANI) October 7, 2025
The scraps of the cylinders were found metres away, with authorities reaching the spot to control the fire.

A team of Hindustan Petroleum removed all the cylinders while following safety mechanisms and protocols, Jaipur Collector Dr Jitendra Soni said.

"Scrap of 42 cylinders was found around the area. They were all exploded cylinders. A total of 120 cylinders were safe. All of them were removed by the team of Hindustan Petroleum that followed all safety measures and protocols to sanitise the area," Soni was quoted as saying by PTI.

Read more: Thousands stranded as 5-km traffic jam chokes Delhi-Kolkata Highway for 3rd consecutive day

The truck carrying the CNG cylinders was reportedly parked outside a hotel as the driver had gone to have food. The tanker rammed the truck leading to a collision which led to the tanker's cabin catching fire while the cylinders were spilled out of the truck and started exploding soon after.

According to the eyewitnesses cited by PTI, a Regional Transport Office team was stopping and checking the vehicles on the highway. The tanker driver changed his lane suddenly and lost control in order to avoid the officials.

However, the district collector stated that the investigation in the matter has begun and the reason for the collision is under probe.

Rajasthan Deputy Chief Minister Prem Chand Bairwa reached the spot to take account of the accident.(Edited by : Unnikrishnan)First Published: Oct 8, 2025 12:13 PM IST

title: Lift carrying 10 workers collapses at Chhattisgarh power plant, 4 dead
content:
HomeIndia NewsLift carrying 10 workers collapses at Chhattisgarh power plant, 4 deadFour workers died and six were injured when a lift collapsed at RKM Powergen plant in Sakti, Chhattisgarh. All were rushed to a hospital, and authorities have launched an investigation.Four workers were killed and six others injured after a lift collapsed from a height at a power plant in Chhattisgarh's Sakti district, officials said on Wednesday.

The incident took place on Tuesday night at RKM Powergen Pvt Ltd's plant in Dabhra area of Ucchpinda village in the district, Sakti Superintendent of Police Ankita Sharma told PTI.
As per preliminary information, 10 workers were inside the lift and descending to the ground after their routine work. The lift suddenly crashed, leaving all of them injured, she said.

The workers were rushed to the Jindal Fortis Hospital in neighbouring Raigarh district, where four of them succumbed to injuries during treatment. Six others are undergoing treatment, the official said.

The capacity of the lift was around 2,000 kilograms and its maintenance work was done recently on September 29, she said.

An investigation was underway to ascertain the cause of the lift crash, the official added.(Edited by : Vivek Dubey)

title: Who is Sergio Gor? The youngest-ever US Ambassador to India
content:
HomeWorld NewsWho is Sergio Gor? The youngest-ever US Ambassador to IndiaGor, 38, was among 107 nominees confirmed by the Senate in a single en bloc vote on Tuesday (October 7). In the final tally, 51 senators voted in favour and 47 against Gor. The confirmations came despite the current US government shutdown.Sergio Gor is the youngest-ever Ambassador of the United States to India.

Gor, 38, was among 107 nominees confirmed by the Senate in a single en bloc vote on Tuesday (October 7). In the final tally, 51 senators voted in favour and 47 against Gor. The confirmations came despite the current US government shutdown.
NO SHUTDOWN SLOWDOWN: Senate Republicans confirmed a staggering 107 nominees in a vote that passed strictly along party lines. Among the key nominees were:

- ex-NFL star Herschel Walker, who was appointed as U.S. Ambassador to the Bahamas
- Sergio Gor, a top Trump advisor… pic.twitter.com/2z9YMw2swT
— Fox News (@FoxNews) October 7, 2025

Gor will come to New Delhi replacing Eric Garcetti, a Democrat appointee who returned to California in January after Donald Trump took over presidency in January.

Other nominees were Paul Kapur of California as Assistant Secretary of State for South Asian Affairs, and Anjani Sinha of Florida as Ambassador to the Republic of Singapore.

Who is Sergio Gor?

In August, Trump had nominated Gor to be the next US Ambassador to India, and Special Envoy for South and Central Asian Affairs.

Describing Gor as a "great friend, who has been at my side for many years", Trump had said that "for the most populous region in the world, it is important that I have someone I can fully trust to deliver on my Agenda and help us Make America Great Again. Sergio will make an incredible Ambassador."

Gor worked as Director of Presidential Personnel recently.

Thanking Trump for his nomination, Gor said it will be his honour to represent the US. "Beyond grateful to Donald Trump for his incredible trust and confidence in nominating me to the be his next US Ambassador to India and Special Envoy for South and Central Asian Affairs! Nothing has made me prouder than to serve the American people through the great work of this Administration! Our White House has achieved historic results in Making America Great Again! It will be the honor of my life to represent the United States!" Gor had tweeted.

Gor graduated from The George Washington University and earned his Bachelor of Arts degree in Political Science and International Affairs in 2008. He was President for The George Washington University's Chapter in the Young America's Foundation. He is currently a member of the Knights of Malta and serves on the Board of Trustees for the Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts.

He has worked in multiple government organisations in the field of communications.

He has served as the Deputy Chief of Staff, Foreign Policy Advisor, and Senior Political Ade for the US Senator Rand Paul of Kentucky. He served as Chief Executive Officer for Winning Team Publishing with Donald Trump, Jr. and Chief Executive Officer for Right for America Super PAC.

USISF reaction

The US-India Strategic Partnership Forum (USISPF) congratulated Gor on his appointment as US Ambassador to India and as Special Envoy for South and Central Asian affairs.

Dr. Mukesh Aghi, USISPF President and Chief Executive Officer (CEO), said, “Ambassador Gor’s confirmation is timely and decisive, and we express our deepest gratitude and respect to President Trump for assigning a trusted confidant who can help execute the President’s vision. Ambassador Gor’s confirmation is a signal to New Delhi that the US-India relationship is a top priority for the administration and the region, and together, through the right diplomatic channels, we can iron out the creases and reach consensus.”First Published: Oct 8, 2025 11:41 AM IST

title: Thousands stranded as 5-km traffic jam chokes Delhi-Kolkata Highway for 3rd consecutive day
content:
HomeIndia NewsThousands stranded as 5-km traffic jam chokes Delhi-Kolkata Highway for 3rd consecutive dayDrivers report no food, water, or administrative support. One driver said that he had managed to cover only 20 kilometres in nearly 24 hours. “No officials have come to check the situation. We are living on tea and biscuits,” he said.Thousands of commuters and truck drivers have been stranded for the third consecutive day on National Highway 19, as a 15 to 20-kilometre-long traffic jam continues to paralyse movement near Sasaram in Rohtas district of Bihar.

The gridlock, caused by ongoing road widening work and exacerbated by heavy rainfall, has left vehicles barely inching forward for hours, according to India Today.

The chaos began earlier this week after torrential rains lashed the region, disrupting ongoing road widening work being undertaken by the National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) near Shivsagar. The rainwater turned diversions muddy and slippery, narrowing the already congested road and forcing vehicles to crawl for hours.

“I've been stuck since yesterday morning, around 8 am. I've barely moved five kilometres,” said truck driver Duban Kumar, who was travelling from Odisha to Delhi, while speaking to India Today. “There's no food or proper facilities. We are surviving on small snacks available along the roadside,” he added.
Another driver, Sanjay Das, told India Today that he had managed to cover only 20 kilometres in nearly 24 hours. “No officials have come to check the situation. We are living on tea and biscuits,” he said.

A user on X (formerly Twitter) posted that the jam, now in its fourth day, has caused vehicles to move as little as five kilometres in an entire day.
रोहतास, बिहार
दिल्ली-कोलकाता हाईवे पर बीते 4 दिनों से लंबा जाम, NH पर 40KM तक फैला जाम

बीते चार दिनों से लगा जाम रोहतास जिले से लेकर औरंगाबाद जिले तक पहुंचा, 24 घंटे में गाड़ीयां 5km रास्ता तय कर पा रही है...@yadavtejashwi @NitishKumar #Bihar #Rohtas #Video pic.twitter.com/NpNG3CL2co

— Gaurav Kumar (@gaurav1307kumar) October 8, 2025

The highway, a key link between Delhi and Kolkata, plays a crucial role in India's freight transport network. NH-19-formerly known as NH-2, forms part of the historic Grand Trunk Road and the Golden Quadrilateral, connecting major cities like Agra, Varanasi, and Dhanbad. Despite its strategic significance, local authorities have yet to take decisive measures to ease the gridlock.

This jam is mostly on the Aurangabad-to-Varanasi stretch. Hundreds of trucks are stuck with no food or water, another stranded driver said.

As the situation worsens, commuters and transporters are urging the NHAI and district administration to intervene swiftly to restore traffic flow and prevent further disruption on one of India's busiest trade corridors through social media platforms.(Edited by : Sudarsanan Mani)

title: Weather update: Heavy rains likely in Tamil Nadu, Karnataka; Delhi receives showers
content:
The weather agency said that conditions were now favourable for further withdrawal of southwest monsoon from the remaining parts of Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh and Uttar Pradesh and some parts of Maharashtra over the next 3-4 days.The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted heavy rainfall and thunderstorms in Tamil Nadu, the southern interior of Karnataka, Kerala, Lakshadweep, and coastal Karnataka over the next few days.

West Bengal, Bihar, Odisha, Chhattisgarh, and the sub-Himalayan regions of West Bengal & Sikkim are also on alert for rainfall and thunderstorms.

The Met Office stated that conditions were now favourable for the further withdrawal of the southwest monsoon from the remaining parts of Gujarat, Madhya Pradesh, and Uttar Pradesh, as well as some parts of Maharashtra, over the next few days.

Cloudy sky in Delhi

Residents in Delhi experienced heavy rains followed by a refreshing chill on Wednesday morning as a western disturbance continued to influence the region, lowering temperatures and diminishing visibility throughout the day. Minimum temperatures are projected to fall, leading to a pleasant chill as the region transitions towards the winter season.

On Wednesday, the IMD predicted a partly cloudy sky for the national capital, with both maximum and minimum temperatures remaining near normal.

The Met Office forecasts a mostly clear sky on Thursday, with temperatures ranging between 31°C and 33°C during the day and 20°C to 22°C at night.

Humid day with scattered showers in Chennai

Chennai is bracing for a humid day with scattered showers on October 8. The temperature is expected to range between 26°C and 33°C, with cloudy skies and humidity averaging around 70-74%. The air quality remains moderate, with an AQI of 83-92, and today's forecast indicates an 85-90% chance of rain with winds gusting up to 21.2-25 km/h.

Light to moderate rainfall over South Peninsular India

South Peninsular India is expected to experience light to moderate rainfall, with isolated periods of heavy rainfall and thunderstorms across various states over the coming days. Isolated heavy rainfall is anticipated over Kerala, Mahe, Tamil Nadu, and south interior Karnataka until October 12, extending to Lakshadweep, Rayalaseema, and coastal Karnataka until October 11.

Additionally, thunderstorms accompanied by gusty winds of 30–40 kmph are likely over the coastal and southern interior of Karnataka and Telangana over the next five days.

Over the same period, lightning is also a risk in Tamil Nadu, Kerala, Mahe, Lakshadweep, north interior Karnataka, coastal Andhra Pradesh, and Rayalaseema. Coastal Andhra Pradesh and Yanam will also see strong surface winds (30-40 kmph) on October 7.

Light to moderate rain and thunderstorms in the Northeastern states

For Northeast India, the forecast indicates light to moderate rain and thunderstorms from October 8 to 10. Isolated heavy rainfall is likely over Assam, Meghalaya, Nagaland, Manipur, Mizoram, and Tripura during this period. Arunachal Pradesh is also expected to see isolated heavy rainfall on October 9 and 10.(Edited by : Sudarsanan Mani)First Published: Oct 8, 2025 10:38 AM IST

title: ED raids 17 sites in luxury car smuggling via Bhutan, Nepal; actors Prithviraj, Dulquer among those searched
content:
HomeIndia NewsED raids 17 sites in luxury car smuggling via Bhutan, Nepal; actors Prithviraj, Dulquer among those searchedThe syndicate allegedly used fake papers purportedly issued by the Indian Army, the US Embassy, and the Ministry of External Affairs to fraudulently register vehicles with Regional Transport Offices (RTOs) in Arunachal Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh, and other states. These cars were then reportedly sold at discounted prices to film actors and high-net-worth individuals (HNIs).The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has launched a major investigation into the alleged smuggling and illegal registration of luxury cars that were being transported from India to Nepal and Bhutan. Acting on intelligence inputs, the agency conducted a large-scale search operation on October 8 in connection with the racket involving cross-border smuggling and foreign exchange violations through the Indo-Bhutan and Indo-Nepal routes.

Teams from the ED's Kochi Zonal Office carried out simultaneous searches at 17 locations across Kerala and Tamil Nadu under the provisions of the Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA).#WATCH | Kerala | The Enforcement Directorate's Kochi Zonal Office is conducting search operations under Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA), 1999 at 17 locations across Kerala and Tamil Nadu in connection with the ongoing probe into the smuggling of high-end luxury vehicles… pic.twitter.com/T5L07j6KCO— ANI (@ANI) October 8, 2025 

The action follows an ongoing probe into the illegal import and sale of high-end vehicles and related foreign exchange transactions. According to sources, investigators uncovered an organised network involved in importing and registering luxury cars such as Land Cruisers, Defenders, and Maseratis using forged documents. The syndicate allegedly used fake papers purportedly issued by the Indian Army, the US Embassy, and the Ministry of External Affairs to fraudulently register vehicles with Regional Transport Offices (RTOs) in Arunachal Pradesh, Himachal Pradesh, and other states. These cars were then reportedly sold at discounted prices to film actors and high-net-worth individuals (HNIs).

The ED stated that the probe has revealed violations of Sections 3, 4, and 8 of FEMA, relating to unauthorised foreign exchange dealings and cross-border transactions via hawala channels.

Officials said the agency is now tracing the money trail, identifying beneficiaries, and tracking the movement of foreign currency linked to the racket.

The searches covered premises in Ernakulam, Thrissur, Kozhikode, Malappuram, Kottayam, and Coimbatore, including those belonging to actors Prithviraj Sukumaran, Dulquer Salmaan, and Amith Chakkalakal, as well as certain vehicle owners, automobile workshops, and dealers. Several electronic devices, documents, and financial records were seized during the operation.(Edited by : Priyanka Rathi)First Published: Oct 8, 2025 10:23 AM IST

title: UK PM Keir Starmer rules out visa deal with India ahead of meeting with PM Modi
content:
HomeIndia NewsUK PM Keir Starmer rules out visa deal with India ahead of meeting with PM ModiPM Modi and his UK counterpart Starmer will meet to strengthen the India UK strategic partnership. They will attend the CEO Forum and the sixth edition of the Global Fintech Fest in Mumbai.The United Kingdom Prime Minister Keir Starmer said the UK will not pursue a visa deal with India ahead of his meeting with Prime Minister Narendra Modi on October 9.

Starmer arrived in Mumbai on Wednesday (October 8) along with a business delegation.

"That isn't part of the plans," he told reporters en route to India when asked about visas, adding the visit was "to take advantage of the free trade agreement that we've already struck".

"Businesses are taking advantage of that. But the issue is not about visas."

Also read | PM Modi to meet British counterpart Keir Starmer | Key points on the agenda

He said visas would not be on the table to attract tech sector professionals from India, though he said more broadly he wanted to have "top talent" in Britain.

Starmer was greeted at the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport by Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis, Deputy CMs Eknath Shinde and Ajit Pawar, and state Governor Acharya Devvrat.

During the flight, Starmer said, "This is the Prime Minister. I'm in the cockpit, and a very warm welcome to BA flight to 9100 to Mumbai. It's really fantastic to have you all onboard. This is the biggest trade mission to India that the UK has ever sent, so I'm much looking forward to working with you as we explore all of the opportunities and take full advantage of the opportunities in our new free trade agreement. So, safe flight everybody."

Modi and Starmer will meet to strengthen the India UK strategic partnership. They will attend the CEO Forum and the sixth edition of the Global Fintech Fest in Mumbai.
#WATCH | Britain's Prime Minister Keir Starmer stands with his business delegation before departing London Heathrow Airport as they head to India to meet with Prime Minister Narendra Modi and promote the recently signed trade deal, in London, Britain.
Source: Pool via REUTERS pic.twitter.com/OtT8PVtRJp

— ANI (@ANI) October 7, 2025


During their meeting, Modi and Starmer will review progress across various areas of the India–UK Comprehensive Strategic Partnership, in line with the Vision 2035 roadmap. The discussions will cover key sectors including trade and investment, technology and innovation, defence and security, climate and energy, health, education, and people-to-people ties.

The two leaders are also expected to interact with business and industry representatives to explore opportunities under the proposed India–UK Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement, envisioned as a cornerstone of the future bilateral economic partnership.

In addition, Modi and Starmer will exchange views on regional and global developments, and engage with industry experts, policymakers, and innovators.First Published: Oct 8, 2025 9:49 AM IST

title: Himachal Pradesh tragedy: At least 16 killed after landslide hits bus in Bilaspur
content:
HomeIndia NewsHimachal Pradesh tragedy: At least 16 killed after landslide hits bus in BilaspurThe incident happened around 6:50 pm on October 7 in the Bhalughat area near Berthin when a huge portion of a mountain gave way and fell on the bus carrying about 25 passengers. The bus was on its way to Ghumarwin from Marotan.At least 16 passengers died, and a few others were missing after a massive landslide hit a private bus in the Bilaspur district of Himachal Pradesh. Two people have been rescued, officials told the media.

The rescue operations are underway. Two siblings, Arushi and Shaurya, are among those rescued.
#WATCH | Bilaspur, Himachal Pradesh | Wreckage of the private bus that was caught in a landslide in the Balurghat area of the Jhanduta sub-division last evening, which resulted in the death of 15 passengers. pic.twitter.com/a3W2CYZjZ2
— ANI (@ANI) October 8, 2025

Chief Minister Sukhvinder Singh Sukhu said, "The death toll in the incident has risen to 16. Two children have been rescued. This is a very sad incident. An announcement has been made to give ₹4 lakh compensation to the families of the deceased."

The incident happened around 6:50 pm on October 7 in the Bhalughat area near Berthin when a huge portion of a mountain gave way and fell on the bus carrying about 25 passengers. The bus was on its way to Ghumarwin from Marotan.

Assistant Commandant, NDRF, Karam Singh told ANI, "The incident occurred around 6:50 pm. About 18 people were travelling in the bus. 15 bodies have already been recovered, 2 live victims may be retrieved and as per local authority, one more victim is still missing; our operation will continue until we find the person."

Pawan Sharma, a resident, told ANI, "We were discussing yesterday that this point is really bad. A landslide occurred here a week ago. The department cleared the debris just a little and let everything else remain there. The bus used to leave from Malari for Marotan every day at 8:45 am. It used to ply twice a day. Thankfully, it wasn't raining at the time and the bodies could be recovered by 1:30 am."

President Droupadi Murmu, Prime Minister Narendra Modi, Union Ministers Amit Shah and JP Nadda, and Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge were among the leaders who condoled the loss of lives in the incident.

Modi announced an ex gratia of ₹2 lakh from the Prime Minister's National Relief Fund (PMNRF) to the next of kin of each deceased, while the injured would get ₹50,000. "Saddened by the loss of lives due to a mishap in Bilaspur, Himachal Pradesh. My thoughts are with the affected people and their families during this difficult time. Praying for the speedy recovery of the injured," Modi wrote on X.First Published: Oct 8, 2025 9:05 AM IST

title: Karnataka's caste census likely to be extended; school timings revised to aid survey work
content:
HomeIndia NewsKarnataka's caste census likely to be extended; school timings revised to aid survey workFrom October 8 to 24, government and aided schools in the Greater Bengaluru area will function from 8 am to 1 pm. Teachers appointed as enumerators will continue the survey work after school hours during this period.The ongoing Social and Educational Survey — commonly known as the "caste census" — which was scheduled to conclude on October 7, is likely to be extended, according to a memo issued by the Department of School Education and Literacy.

The department has revised school timings after the Dasara holidays to facilitate the completion of the survey work by teachers. From October 8 to 24, government and aided schools in the Greater Bengaluru area will function from 8 am to 1 pm. Teachers appointed as enumerators will continue the survey work after school hours during this period.

In the rest of the state, government and aided schools will follow the same 8 am to 1 pm schedule from October 8 to 12.

The memo dated October 6 cites a letter from the Backward Classes Welfare Department seeking additional time to finish the survey. It noted that the change in school timings has been made to safeguard students' academic interests and ensure classes are not disrupted after the mid-year break.

The survey, launched on September 22 by the Karnataka State Commission for Backward Classes, was initially set to end on October 7. However, the exercise was delayed in the Greater Bengaluru region due to training and preparatory requirements, and is still underway.

A formal announcement regarding the extension is awaited from the Commission.

The survey, estimated to cost ₹420 crore, is based on a 60-question questionnaire and is being conducted through a scientific methodology, officials said. The previous Social and Educational Survey conducted in 2015, which cost ₹165.51 crore, was eventually scrapped.

title: Indian Air Force Day 2025: Why it's important
content: Indian Air Force Day is observed annually on October 8, commemorating the establishment of one of the nation’s most respected armed forces organisations.1 / 6Founded in 1932, the Indian Air Force plays a vital role in securing the country’s airspace and protecting India’s national and humanitarian interests against all threats. FILE PHOTO: The Surya Kiran aerobatic display team of the Indian Air Force (IAF) flies BAE Hawk Mk 132 aircrafts during an airshow in Mumbai, January 13, 2024. REUTERS/Francis Mascarenhas2 / 6The day serves as a tribute to the unwavering dedication and passion of IAF personnel, while also highlighting the many technological advancements achieved over the years. FILE PHOTO: Members of Agniveervayu, Indian Air Force's first-ever all-women drill team, perform in front of India Gate war memorial in New Delhi, India, July 26, 2024. REUTERS/Priyanshu Singh3 / 6Launched as an auxiliary force under British rule on October 8, 1932, the Indian Air Force was originally named the Royal Indian Air Force (RIAF). The RIAF’s maiden operational flight took off on April 1, 1933, carrying six RAF-trained officers and 19 Havai Sepoys. FILE PHOTO: An Indian Air Force fighter jet flies past during the Republic Day parade in New Delhi, India, January 26, 2025. REUTERS/Adnan Abidi4 / 6The RIAF made significant contributions during World War II and earned its ‘Royal’ prefix in 1945 for its service. When India gained independence on August 15, 1947, after 200 years of British colonial rule, and became a republic in 1950, the prefix was officially removed, and the force was formally established as the Indian Air Force. FILE PHOTO: Indian Air Force (IAF) Suryakiran aerobatic team performs during the "Aero India 2025" air show at Yelahanka air base in Bengaluru, India, February 10, 2025. REUTERS/Abinaya Kalyanasundaram5 / 6The IAF has a proud history of playing a major role in some of India’s most critical conflicts. These include the Indo-Pak wars of 1947, 1965, 1971 and 1999, as well as the 1962 Sino-Indian War. The force also took part in significant operations such as Operation Poomalai in 1987 and Operation Safed Sagar during the Kargil war in 1999. FILE PHOTO: An Indian Air Force C295 aircraft, carrying rescue and relief operations of flash floods at Dharali, lands at the Jolly Grant Airport, Dehradun, India, August 9, 2025. REUTERS/Francis Mascarenhas6 / 6Indian Air Force Day honours the dedication of IAF personnel and celebrates the force’s technological advancements in safeguarding India’s airspace and responding to crises. FILE PHOTO: Indian Air Force (IAF)'s light combat aircraft "Tejas" fires a missile during "Vayu Shakti", or Air Power exercise in Pokhran, Rajasthan state, India, February 16, 2019. REUTERS/Amit Dave/File Photo

title: New base years to boost GDP coverage, inflation basket will cover over 350 items: MoSPI Secy Garg
content:
HomeEconomy NewsNew base years to boost GDP coverage, inflation basket will cover over 350 items: MoSPI Secy GargWith the proportion of food items in the CPI having come down as per the Household Consumption Expenditure Survey, the weightage of food, particularly cereals, in the new CPI is also expected to decline. While spending on vegetables, fruits, and processed foods has gone up, which the new inflation basket will reflect.India’s upcoming base year revisions for GDP, CPI and IIP will significantly expand the base and coverage of sectors, particularly if the government gets access to more granular data, MoSPI Secretary Saurabh Garg said in an interaction with CNBC-TV18.

Garg said the national accounts and GDP series will draw from new and alternate data sources, including GST data, digital platforms such as e-VAHAN, and payments data.

“The new series will capture a much larger part of the digital economy. GDP coverage will increase as we incorporate more real-time and electronic data,” he explained.

Garg added that the Consumer Price Index (CPI) will also see a substantial overhaul. The CPI basket size will rise from 299 to over 350 items, “at least”, with e-commerce to be included for the first time.

“A lot of digital products will move into the CPI basket, capturing products and sources of data, like where the households are purchasing - the revision will increase the number of markets, products and types of markets from where you are getting the data," Garg said.

With the proportion of food items in the CPI having come down as per the Household Consumption Expenditure Survey, the weightage of food, particularly cereals, in the new CPI is also expected to decline. While spending on vegetables, fruits, and processed foods has gone up, which the new inflation basket will reflect.

The Index of Industrial Production (IIP) will similarly undergo expansion, with more sectors being added to better capture industrial activity.
“In all three revisions — national accounts, CPI, and IIP — the coverage will deepen and granularity will increase, as more data sources are brought in. This will help us build a more comprehensive and accurate picture of the economy,” the MoSPI Secretary said.

According to Garg, the new data series will roll out in early 2026.

• The new CPI series with 2024 as the base year for January will be released on February 12, 2026.

• The revised GDP series with 2022–23 as the base year will be released by the end of February 2026, meaning the Second Advance Estimates of FY26 GDP will be on the new base year.

• The new IIP series, based on April 2026 data, will be released in May 2026.

For CPI and IIP, the government is not considering any changes to the release timelines.

“All the base year revisions are on track. By early 2026, the economy’s key indicators—GDP, CPI, and IIP—will all reflect these changes,” Garg affirmed.

The MoSPI (Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation) will start stakeholder consultations on the new methodologies for each of the data sets by the end of this month or early November, initially in Delhi and Mumbai.

title: Indian man fighting alongside Russian military surrenders to Ukrainian forces
content:
HomeIndia NewsIndian man fighting alongside Russian military surrenders to Ukrainian forcesIndia has been repeatedly asking Russia to release all Indians serving as support staff, such as cooks and helpers, with Russian military units.An Indian national fighting alongside the Russian military surrendered to Ukrainian forces, the Ukrainian military said on Tuesday.

The 63rd Mechanised Brigade of the Ukrainian military, on its Telegram channel, released a video of the Indian national who identified himself as Majoti Sahil Mohamed Hussein from Gujarat.

There was no word from Indian officials on the matter.

Official sources said the Indian embassy in Kyiv was ascertaining the veracity of the report.

It has not received any formal communication from Ukrainian authorities on the matter, they said.

The Ukrainian military said 22-year-old Hussein came to Russia to study at a university, The Kyiv Independent newspaper reported.

In the video, Hussein said he was sentenced to seven years in a Russian prison on drug-related charges and was offered the opportunity to sign a contract with the Russian military to avoid further punishment.

"I didn't want to stay in prison, so I signed a contract for the special military operation. But I wanted to get out of there," Hussein said.

After 16 days of training, Hussein was sent on his first combat mission on October 1, and it lasted three days.

Following a fight with his commander, he surrendered to Ukrainian troops.

"I came across a Ukrainian trench position about two to three kilometres away," he said.

"I immediately put down my rifle and said that I didn't want to fight. I needed help. I don't want to go back to Russia," he added.

The 63rd Mechanised Brigade in its Telegram post said Hussein studied in Russia, but was caught with drugs.

"In order not to go to prison, he went to war," the post said.

The Ministry of External Affairs last month said that India had strongly called upon Russia to release and repatriate 27 Indian nationals currently serving with the Russian Army.

There have been reports that some Indians on student and business visas were forced into joining Russian military units deployed on the frontlines of the war in Ukraine.

India has been repeatedly asking Russia to release all Indians serving as support staff, such as cooks and helpers, with Russian military units.

The issue was raised by Prime Minister Narendra Modi during his visit to Russia last year as well.

According to official data, the number of Indians recruited by the Russian military is now more than 150.

At least 12 Indians were killed while fighting on the frontlines of the conflict in Ukraine, while 96 were discharged by Russian authorities.

Another 16 have been listed as missing.

title: CPI(ML) Liberation rejects offer to fight on 19 seats, says not a 'dignified proposal'
content:
HomeIndia NewsPolitics NewsCPI(ML) Liberation rejects offer to fight on 19 seats, says not a 'dignified proposal'CPI (Marxist-Leninist) Liberation rejects RJD-led Mahagathbandhan's 19-seat offer for assembly polls, seeks a more dignified proposal.The CPI (Marxist-Leninist) Liberation has rejected an offer to fight on 19 seats in the upcoming assembly polls as a part of the Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD)-led Mahagathbandhan, a party source said.

It was not a ”dignified proposal,” the person said.

According to the source, the Left party was offered the same number of seats it contested for in the 2020 assembly polls.

”At least three of our seats were also changed,” the source said.
In 2020, the Communist Party of India (Marxist-Leninist) Liberation had fought on 19 seats, and won 12. This time, the Left party had asked for around 40 seats to fight.

”CPI(ML) rejected the offer as it was not a dignified proposal, and we are going to make a fresh proposal to fight around 30 seats,” the source said.

”We are reducing the number of seats by almost 25 per cent,” the person said.

The CPI(ML) has also argued that the party helped Mahagathbandhan not just on the seats they fought, but also securing votes in surrounding areas.

Asked about the party’s position in case their new offer is not accepted, the source said, ”all options are open.” The Mahagathbandhan is a grouping of the Congress, the Left parties – CPI, CPI(M), and CPI(ML) – and Mukesh Sahni’s Vikassheel Insaan Party (VIP). The alliance is led by the Rashtriya Janata Dal.

In 2020, of the allies, the RJD contested 144 seats and won 75, while the Congress contested 70 seats and won 19.

title: PM Narendra Modi to meet British counterpart Keir Starmer in Maharashtra | Key points on the agenda
content:
HomeIndia NewsPM Modi to meet British counterpart Keir Starmer in Maharashtra | Key points on the agendaPM Modi will host Starmer in Mumbai on October 9 at around 10 am. Thereafter, both leaders will attend the CEO Forum at the Jio World Centre at around 1:40 pm. They will attend the 6th edition of the Global Fintech Fest at around 2:45 pm and will also deliver keynote addresses at the fest.British Prime Minister Sir Keir Starmer will be on his first official visit to India on October 8 and 9, following an invitation from his Indian counterpart Narendra Modi.

PM Modi will host Starmer in Mumbai on October 9 at around 10 am.

Thereafter, both leaders will attend the CEO Forum at the Jio World Centre at around 1:40 pm. They will attend the 6th edition of the Global Fintech Fest at around 2:45 pm and will also deliver keynote addresses at the fest.

UK PM’s visit and Global Fintech Fest

The two leaders will meet in Mumbai to review the progress of the India-UK Comprehensive Strategic Partnership under the 'Vision 2035' roadmap.
“During the visit, the two Prime Ministers will take stock of progress in diverse aspects of the India-UK Comprehensive Strategic Partnership in line with ‘Vision 2035’, a focussed and time bound 10-year roadmap of programmes and initiatives in key pillars of trade and investment, technology and innovation, defence and security, climate and energy, health, education and people to people relations,” the PMO said.

Prime Minister Modi and Prime Minister Starmer will also meet business and industry leaders to discuss the opportunities presented by the India-UK Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), which is a key component of the future India-UK economic partnership. They will also discuss problems of regional and global significance. The leaders will also meet with industry professionals, policymakers, and innovators.

The visit will also include attendance at the Global Fintech Fest 2025. The two leaders will attend the 6th edition of the Global Fintech Fest, which will be held at the Jio World Centre in Mumbai, and will deliver keynote addresses on the occasion.

This year, the fest will bring together innovators, policymakers, central bankers, regulators, investors, academicians and industry leaders from across the world. It is anticipated to draw over 100,000 attendees from more than 75 countries, making it one of the world's largest fintech events.

The event will attract over 7,500 organisations, 800 speakers, 400 exhibitors, and 70 regulators from both Indian and international jurisdictions.

Strategic partnership agenda

The visit, Starmer's first official trip to India, follows a meeting between the two leaders in July 2025, during which they welcomed the signing of the CETA. According to the Ministry of External Affairs, the two Prime Ministers welcomed the signing of the historic India-UK Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), which will raise the Comprehensive Strategic Partnership to a new level, while significantly enhancing bilateral trade, investment, economic collaborations and job creation in both economies."(Edited by : Sudarsanan Mani)First Published: Oct 7, 2025 7:03 PM IST

title: Five smart gadgets that will help you breathe cleaner air at home
content: Five smart gadgets that will help you breathe cleaner air at homeFrom air purifiers to smart sensors, these five gadgets will help you create a cleaner, healthier indoor environment for your home. Read on:1 / 7With rising levels of indoor and outdoor pollution, ensuring clean air inside homes has become increasingly important. From dust and allergens to mould spores and harmful gases, indoor air can often contain hidden pollutants that affect health and comfort. A range of innovative devices now make it easier to monitor and improve indoor air quality. Take a look at five smart gadgets that can help you breathe easier at home. (PTI Photo)2 / 71. Air Purifiers are widely recognised as one of the most effective tools for improving indoor air quality. Equipped with HEPA (High-Efficiency Particulate Air) filters, they trap airborne particles as small as 0.3 microns, including pollen, pet dander, dust, and some bacteria. These devices are especially beneficial for households with pets or people suffering from allergies. Some advanced models also combine HEPA filtration with UV-C light technology, providing an additional layer of protection by neutralising microorganisms. (Photo: Shutterstock)3 / 72. Smart Air Quality Monitors help in understanding what all substances are there in the air. They track levels of pollutants such as carbon dioxide (CO₂), volatile organic compounds (VOCs), PM 2.5 particles, and humidity. These compact sensors display real-time data on mobile apps, enabling homeowners to adjust ventilation or activate purifiers as needed. (Image: Rob Schultz_IDG)4 / 73. Humidifiers: Dry indoor air can lead to respiratory discomfort and skin irritation, especially in colder months. Smart humidifiers maintain optimal moisture levels between 40% and 60%, helping prevent dryness while supporting better respiratory health. Some models also clean water before releasing mist and allow the addition of essential oils for a fresher environment. (Image: Wikipedia)5 / 74. UV Air Treatment Systems, often integrated into HVAC units, these gadgets use ultraviolet light to kill bacteria, viruses, and mould spores as air circulates. This creates an additional barrier against airborne pathogens, reducing the spread of illnesses. Such systems are particularly useful during flu season or in homes with vulnerable individuals. (Representative Image from Wikipedia)6 / 75. Smart Thermostats: Modern smart thermostats offer air quality monitoring features in addition to temperature control. They can detect when indoor air becomes polluted and automatically trigger ventilation systems to refresh the air. Real-time data is accessible via mobile apps, enabling users to maintain healthy indoor conditions with minimal effort. (Image: Wikipedia)7 / 7Investing in a combination of these devices can significantly enhance indoor air quality. Whether through filtration, monitoring, humidity control, or germicidal technology, these smart gadgets are making homes healthier and more comfortable because breathing clean air keeps you healthy. (Image: Agencies)

title: Drug Controller recommends Sresan Pharma's licence cancellation after high DEG levels found in cough syrups
content:
HomeIndia NewsHealthcare NewsDrug Controller recommends Sresan Pharma's licence cancellation after high DEG levels found in cough syrupsThe deaths of children due to consumption of these contaminated cough syrups have reignited concerns about quality control lapses in India’s pharmaceutical supply chain. Read on:In the wake of the tragic deaths of several children suspected to be linked to the consumption of contaminated cough syrup, the central and state drug regulators have swung into action.

Sources told CNBC-TV18 that a series of tests conducted over the past few days have confirmed the presence of diethylene glycol (DEG)—a toxic industrial solvent—in certain cough syrup samples, leading the Drug Controller General of India (DCGI) under the Central Drugs Standard Control Organisation (CDSCO) to recommend the cancellation of Sresan Pharma’s manufacturing licence.

According to sources, 19 samples have been tested so far by the CDSCO, Madhya Pradesh Food and Drugs Administration (MP FDA), and Tamil Nadu Food and Drugs Administration (TN FDA), as authorities attempt to trace the source of the contamination that has raised nationwide alarm.

The first set of test results, sources said, came on October 3, when six samples tested by CDSCO and three by MP FDA were found to be free of DEG and ethylene glycol (EG). However, the situation changed dramatically later that night when the TN FDA submitted test results of Coldrif syrup, manufactured by Sresan Pharma, which revealed 48% DEG—a level hundreds of times above the permissible limit of 0.1%.

The following day, on October 4, more samples of Coldrif collected from retail outlets and pharmacies in Madhya Pradesh were tested, again confirming the presence of 46% DEG, sources said. By the end of the day, 10 samples had been tested, several of which confirmed the same pattern of contamination in syrups produced by Sresan Pharma.

Read more: Cough syrup linked deaths: PIL seeks Supreme Court intervention as toll rises, MP bans 2 more drugs

Sources further said that on October 5 and 6, additional test reports from the MP FDA revealed that two other products—Refile Syrup and Respifresh TR Syrup—also contained DEG, though at relatively lower levels. Refile Syrup showed 0.616% DEG and Respifresh TR Syrup showed 1.342% DEG, but these were still above the permissible limit.

On the basis of these findings, sources told CNBC-TV18 that the DCGI has written to the Tamil Nadu FDA, urging immediate cancellation of Sresan Pharma’s licence. Officials have also been asked to step up vigilance and conduct a wider probe to identify other manufacturers possibly flouting drug safety norms.

The deaths have reignited concerns about quality control lapses in India’s pharmaceutical supply chain, especially after previous global incidents involving DEG contamination in cough syrups exported from India. Regulatory authorities are now under growing pressure to ensure strict enforcement of manufacturing standards and prevent further tragedies.

Further action from both central and state agencies is awaited as investigations continue into how the contamination occurred and whether lapses in testing or oversight contributed to the crisis.
